metadata.title: CVE-2018-6139 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient target checks on the chrome.debugger API in DevTools in GoogleChrome prior to 67.0.3396.62 allowed an attacker who convinced a user toinstall a malicious extension to execute arbitrary code via a craftedChrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
